message.content:
{"id": "18934", "title": "Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "Building F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2 and KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only) causes the scrollbars to be enabled in the ImageAnalyzer example. However, the scrollbars are non-functional and do not have any effect. This issue is particularly noticeable when opening a small image, such as an icon, as the scrollbars give the false impression of being able to scroll.", 
"EB": "The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to avoid confusion and provide a consistent user experience.", 
"SR": "Disable the scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example to prevent them from being misleading and non-functional."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '18934', 'title': 'Bug 18934Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example', 'description': '', 'OB': "Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)Open the ImageAnalyzer example.Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don'thave any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars arejust misleading because they don't do anything. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
